messages: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:28): TabAtkins_: Mike Kay *is* an XSLT 2.0 implementor
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:29): publish another WD on the ninth?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:29): that seems somewhat implausible
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (23:36): pulls in innerHTML
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:37): bitbucket should get some auto checkout place

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:38): in related trivia, I am not too happy with 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e removing Selection from the draft without some kind of published alternative published elsewhere
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:39): we learned that with URLs it kind of sucks when that happens and we should have taken more note of that
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:39): i waited til it was in the Range spec
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:39): the text is unchanged
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:40): I guess if bitbucket was more usable it would have mattered less
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:40): pointing colleagues to http://bitbucket.org/ms2ger/dom-range rather than some kind of HTML readable version kind of sucks
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:44): 8798deca92af07eccdb21a777058f42e: I think it's not a good idea to suggest that XSLT 2.0 would be supported if enough people want it
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:45): because the value of "enough" would have to be quite large to offset the dependence on the PSVI
8798deca92af07eccdb21a777058f42e (23:45): Still, if "enough" people do, it will be.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:46): 8798deca92af07eccdb21a777058f42e: but it can give people wrong ideas, still
8798deca92af07eccdb21a777058f42e (23:46): What's the PSVI?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:47): 8798deca92af07eccdb21a777058f42e: Post-Schema Validation Infoset
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:47): 8798deca92af07eccdb21a777058f42e: good for you if you haven't run into it before
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:49): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: can you host a copy on html5.org?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:54): yeah, that might be an idea
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:55): though not entirely sure how to update it all automatically
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:55): if 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 has any ideas maybe we can sort that out next week
72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c (00:06): hi everyone im doing some work for the ruby port of html5lib, is someone interested ?
9ac93fad7c9a77617c9831c44389c55b (00:09): 72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c: i would be interested
9ac93fad7c9a77617c9831c44389c55b (00:10): been a while since i looked at the code though

72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c (00:10): 9ac93fad7c9a77617c9831c44389c55b: cool, im pushing to https://github.com 72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c/html5lib/commits 72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c-ruby if you have time to review
72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c (00:11): i dont know mercurial sorry
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:11): been a while since any looked at the code, I think :)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:11): If you know git, Mercurial is not hard to pick up.
29b907508e8beec9ae96654811d6646b (00:11): I find the commands in mercurial make a little more sense than in git
29b907508e8beec9ae96654811d6646b (00:12): (though I still use git)
9ac93fad7c9a77617c9831c44389c55b (00:12): 72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c: nice. won't have time to play until next week, but i'd certainly be willing to help out
9ac93fad7c9a77617c9831c44389c55b (00:12): amazes me that no one is looking into a portable C port though
72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c (00:12): cool i you .patch files i can send it to you
9ac93fad7c9a77617c9831c44389c55b (00:13): or adding it to libxml
9ac93fad7c9a77617c9831c44389c55b (00:13): both options would make it very available from other langs
9ac93fad7c9a77617c9831c44389c55b (00:13): 72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c: git is better than patches :)
9ac93fad7c9a77617c9831c44389c55b (00:13): i'd like to learn more mercurial though
72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c (00:13): maybe waiting that the spec is finalized
72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c (00:18): is the Ruby code is generated by the python one ?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:19): No
72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c (00:19): s/python/Python/
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:20): The PHP, Python, and Ruby copies are all separate. The Python3 is basically generated by 2to3 from the Python one, though.
72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c (00:20): oki sometime its like it was a translate
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:20): In what way?
72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c (00:24): for example https://github.com 72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c/html5lib/blob/0f3b0ead1a76c044fbbe8df411cf49e48598aa47/ruby/lib/html5/filters/rfc2046.rb
72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c (00:27): and Python https://github.com 72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c/html5lib/blob/master/python3/src/html5lib/filters/rfc2046.py
72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c (00:27): look the same :)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:30): 72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c: The Ruby one was initially created by manually translating from the Python version, I believe
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:30): (and then it got mostly abandoned)
9ac93fad7c9a77617c9831c44389c55b (00:30): 72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c: what's your use case?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:31): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: "mostly"? In what way not "totally"?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:31): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: There were subsequent time periods in which people worked on it
72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c (00:31): im using the gem for a Ruby project
72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c (00:32): https://github.com 72b318ad486f8fd865a73d87f3adae1c/validate-website
